result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

clerked by CSmith
Defendant William A Meyer in court with attorney Wilber Rex Johnson.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CT17, 15CT37, 15CM216, 15TR63, 15TR158, 15TR159, 15TR112 AND 14TR2698.

15CT17: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. State makes argument. Defense makes argument.
.154 non-aggrevated 
Court finds Defendant guilty and orders: 
$1,379.00 fine with 60 DTP or payment plan.
10 days jail with Good Time and Huber.  Credit for 1 day served. Must report by 3:00 p.m. today. May serve jail time in Washburn County if at no cost to Barron County.
12 month DL revocation
12 month IID
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  

15CT37, 15CM216, 15TR63, 15TR158, 15TR159 and 15TR112 - DRI

14TR2698: Stipulation and Order filed. Court approves and imposes $937.50 forfeiture, 8 month DL revocation, 12 month IID

15CT17 and 14TR2698: Court orders license revocations retroactive to date of offenses. 

Copy to DE
Jail - faxed.

Defendant William A Meyer in court by telephone with attorney Wilber Rex Johnson by telephone.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense's motion to exclude witnesses - State moves to dismiss without prejudice - Court relates - Attorney Johnson relates - Discussion held - Court orders State to file witness list by Noon tomorrow - Court denies motion to exclude witnesses at this time.
Initial appearances on other 2 files to be taken up next Monday at 8:00 am.
